basics.name: Michael Gimelfarb
basics.label: AI Researcher
basics.summary: I am a researcher in reinforcement learning and planning, a branch of artificial intelligence that studies how an intelligent agent should interact with a dynamic environment to maximize cumulative reward.

work.name: RVL Lab, Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto
work.summary: Developed robust offline reinforcement learning algorithms in which an agent must evaluate a policy using only a pre-existing data set without any direct interactions with an environment. The advantages of learned world models and guided generative diffusion models explored as they relate to robustness and scalability of learning.

work.name: D3M Lab, University of Toronto
work.summary: Developed novel algorithms for efficient and scalable planning in high-dimensional spaces, particularly using symbolic methods, nonlinear optimization, and gradient-based optimization. Developed and maintained the Python planning library pyRDDLGym.

work.name: Google Deepmind UK (Remote)
work.summary: Derived novel algorithms for continual/lifelong reinforcement learning, where an agent must learn to achieve a long sequence of diverse goals in the most efficient way possible.

work.name: Russell Investments
work.summary: Collected and analyzed numerical and qualitative data on competing mutual funds to guide decision-making and strategy. Wrote macros to automate the preparation and analysis of client portfolio data, resulting in much faster turn-around time.

education.institution: Schulich School of Business, York University
